intro: Quararibea amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian guayacan, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is known for its hard, dense wood, which has historically been used for crafting and construction. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
